{"step_by_step_thinking": "Onodi cells are a type of ethmoidal air cells that are located posterior to the optic nerve and can extend laterally to the sphenoid sinus. Haller cells, on the other hand, are anterior ethmoidal air cells that are located medial to the internal carotid artery. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Optic nerve and internal carotid artery.", "answer_choice": "B"}
